data.title: Scoping on javascript variables definition
data.body:
While inspecting scopes for Javascript, if a variable is defined after `let` or `var`, its scope will rightly be within `meta.definition.variable`, while defining an additional variable after a comma results in that variable lacking the `meta.definition.variable` scope, making it, scope wise, indistinguishable from any other `readwrite` variable.

Is this the intended behavior?

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4

![Correct](https://image.prntscr.com/image/94c2be268f414617b53f333858bff74c.png)
![Incorrect](http://i.prntscr.com/5bb086c422e8484aa10887df1fbf501d.png)

data.title: Terminal leaks processes
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13 insider
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. clone vscode-eslint repository
2. chdir to eslint/eslint-server
3. open terminal (I use powershell as the terminal, not sure if it matters)
4. type npm install
5. type npm run watch
6. Kill the terminal by pressing the garbage bin button

Open a process explorer

Observe: there are still two process orphaned conhost.exe and node.exe

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/26146494/aeee5eb8-3af0-11e7-99a1-d095b0becfd0.png)

data.title: Change All Occurrences doesn't select all occurences
data.body:
I have a JSON export of around 600k lines with a lot of repeating sections and Change All Occurrences selects only a small subset of all occurrences at a time.

In my case number of selections is always limited to 999. Even if I select a smaller section it's still limited to 999 selections so it's not a character limit.

Might be related to #331

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Fedora 25 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a huge JSON with a lot of repeating sections
2. Select a section and press Ctrl+F2

data.title: vscode + anaconda virtual environment + ubuntu terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.12.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04  Anaconda3-4.3.1-Linux-x86_64.sh

When launching vscode from terminal with command code while a virtual anaconda environment is activated (source activate myenv). Vs  code  integrated terminal  would be inherit outsite.It's work for virtualenv but It didn't work for anaconda.
Steps to Reproduce:

1 open terminal,and check no pythonpath in my settings.json
2 activate a virtual anaconda environment (source activate django)
3 cd in my project.and type    code .
4 in vs code open integrated terminal
5 with pip list check in
6 it looks like others working fine only terminal couldn't inherit environment
7 I check the issue.found that when code . .The order $PATH change .
before is:
/home/mighty/anaconda3/envs/django/bin:/home/mighty/anaconda3/bin:{JAVA_HOME}/bin:/usr/local/sbin: ....
after is :
/home/mighty/anaconda3/bin:/home/mighty/anaconda3/envs/django/bin:/home/mighty/anaconda3/bin:{JAVA_HOME}/bin:......

data.title: hygiene task broke Travis CI build
data.body:
As title, the files under `build/tfs` broke the Travis build. (`gulp hygiene` also failed locally)

```
$ gulp hygiene --silent
build/tfs/common/enqueue.js(7,1): Bad whitespace indentation
...
build/tfs/common/enqueue.js(124,1): Bad whitespace indentation
build/tfs/common/publish.js(7,1): Bad whitespace indentation
...
build/tfs/common/publish.js(274,1): Bad whitespace indentation

The command "gulp hygiene --silent" exited with 1.
```

I'm not sure if `!build/tfs/**` should be in `eolFilter`? or which types of files should be included in?

```
const eolFilter = [
	'**',
	'!ThirdPartyNotices.txt',
	'!LICENSE.txt',
	'!extensions/**/out/**',
	'!**/node_modules/**',
	'!**/fixtures/**',
	'!**/*.{svg,exe,png,bmp,scpt,bat,cmd,cur,ttf,woff,eot}',
	'!build/{lib,tslintRules}/**/*.js',
	'!build/monaco/**',     // why?
	'!build/win32/**',
	'!build/tfs/**',     // added line to pass the check
	'!build/**/*.sh',
	'!**/Dockerfile'
];
```

data.title: Typescript language erroneously reports issues in Problems pane
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.12.2 - OS Version: Mac 10.12.3 First, just wanted to say thanks for making such a great product. I've been using VSCode regularly for over a year now and it's just been getting better and better. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start Typescript build task in watch mode. 2. Several erroneous issues are reported in the Problem pane (see screenshot). 3. Go to file with reported problem. Problem is no longer reported. More info: - Using Typescript 2.3.2 using Workspace copy. - I noticed that whenever I run into these erroneous Typescript errors - when I try running `tsc ` from the CLI, none of these erroneous type errors appear which is why I thought this issue might be with VSCode and not Typescript itself.

data.title: Theming: search decoration in overview ruler (find widget, search viewlet)
data.body:
Noticed this that the search viewlet and the find widget use a hardcoded color for search results in the overview ruler. I am not sure if we actually allow any of the overview colors to be themed.

- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/search/common/searchModel.ts#L100
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/contrib/find/common/findDecorations.ts#L158

data.title: CSS Tab Completions giving unexpected results ?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: MacOS sierra 10.12.4
## List of installed extensions
```
EditorConfig.EditorConfig@0.9.3
HookyQR.beautify@1.0.2
christian-kohler.path-intellisense@1.4.2
dbaeumer.vscode-eslint@1.2.8
dracula-theme.theme-dracula@1.17.0
eg2.tslint@0.15.0
mitchdenny.ecdc@0.10.3
msjsdiag.debugger-for-chrome@3.1.1
naumovs.theme-oceanicnext@0.0.4
robertohuertasm.vscode-icons@7.7.0
```
## Steps to Reproduce:
### Expected
```scss
//type and hit tab.
df --> display: flex;
posa --> position: absolute;
```

### Actual
```scss
//type and hit tab
df --> stroke-dashoffset: 
posa --> padding-block-start: 
```

The funny thing is, if I hit undo and hit tab again, they give me the desired result. So
```scss
df --> stroke-dashoffset: **UNDO** df --> display: flex;
```

**NOTE:** The problem exists in the insiders build, 1.13.0 too with ZERO extensions installed.

data.title: Fix for terminal.foreground not working
Can't rebind search key (cmd + shift + f)
data.body:
VSCode Version: Version 1.12.2 (1.12.2)
OS Version: OS X E Capitan 10.11.6

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. To keybindings.json add:
```json
    {
        "key": "shift+cmd+r",
        "command": "search.action.focusActiveEditor",
        "when": "searchInputBoxFocus && searchViewletVisible"
    }
```

**Expected**
Search panel opens 
Behavior should be the same as if you pressed <kbd>cmd + shift + f</kbd>

**Actual**
Nothing happens

data.title: Ctrl + j not working in integrated terminal with zsh
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.2 (1.12.2)
- OS Version: OS X E Capitan 10.11.6

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open integrated terminal <kbd>ctrl+`</kbd>
2. In terminal:
```bash
> bindkey '^j' backward-word #edited
> enter some text
```
3. Input key combination <kbd>ctrl + j</kbd>

**Expected**
Cursor moves back a word, this the behavior that iTerm and Terminal.app exhibit

**Actual**
Newline is sent, essentially the same as using <kbd>return</kbd>
